What is the plaintext message if the key length is 4 and the message was encrypted according to the Vigenere cipher?

To decrypt the message, we will use the Vigenere decryption formula:

Plaintext = (Ciphertext - Key) mod 26

We will use the keyword "MATH" repeatedly to decrypt the ciphertext "WDSRQBONQJLX."

Ciphertext: W  D  S  R  Q  B  O  N  Q  J  L  X
Keyword:    M  A  T  H  M  A  T  H  M  A  T  H
Plaintext:  ?

Now, we will decrypt each letter using the formula:

W - M = (22 - 12) mod 26 = 10 -> K
D - A = (3 - 0) mod 26 = 3 -> D
S - T = (18 - 19) mod 26 = 25 -> Z
R - H = (17 - 7) mod 26 = 10 -> K

Q - M = (16 - 12) mod 26 = 4 -> E
B - A = (1 - 0) mod 26 = 1 -> B
O - T = (14 - 19) mod 26 = 21 -> V
N - H = (13 - 7) mod 26 = 6 -> G

Q - M = (16 - 12) mod 26 = 4 -> E
J - A = (9 - 0) mod 26 = 9 -> J
L - T = (11 - 19) mod 26 = 18 -> S
X - H = (23 - 7) mod 26 = 16 -> Q

The decrypted plaintext message is "KDZKEBVGESJQ."
